intro: Mesembryanthemum chrysum, commonly known as the evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves helps it survive in dry conditions.
